message: Hi Bob, I'm selling this product that I believe will be of great value to you. I'm offering it to you for $120.  Let me know what you think!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
Bob, I appreciate your interest in the product. While $90 is tempting, I'm looking for a price closer to $110 to make this worthwhile for me.  What do you think?
I understand you're looking for a price closer to $110, but I'm still a bit hesitant. How about $95?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. $95 is a step in the right direction, but I'm still looking to get closer to my asking price of $110.  Would you be willing to meet me at $105?  This would be a fair compromise, I believe.
I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go all the way to $105. How about $100?

Bob, I appreciate your compromise. While I'm happy to see we're getting closer, $100 is still a bit lower than what I need to make this worthwhile.  Would you be willing to go up to $102.50? This would be a fair middle ground that I believe we can both agree on.
I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I'm still a bit hesitant to go up to $102.50. How about $99?
